DOC.brief_summary: Pliaglis® Cream versus compound topical anesthetic pain management Restylane® injection correction nasolabial fold .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluate Efficacy , Safety & Subject Satisfaction Pain Management With Pliaglis® Cream Dermal Filler Injections
DOC.detailed_description: Open-label , randomize study design assess effectiveness topical anesthetic ( Pliaglis® Cream ) versus compound topical anesthetic needle stick , immediately , one three hour Restylane® injection nasolabial fold .
DOC.criteria: Male Female Subjects 30 65 year age Subject undergoing cosmetic dermal filler injection correction nasolabial fold . Treatment sit comparable , require number injection nasolabial fold Subjects diagnose moderate nasolabial fold ( Wrinkle Severity Rating Scale grade 3 ) Subjects treatment dermatologic condition face , may interfere safe evaluation study treatment ( e.g . eczema , psoriasis , severe sundamage , dermatitis ) , damage , denude broken skin designate treatment site and/or scar infection area treat Subjects take prescription nonprescription analgesic medication 24 hour period prior procedure Subjects history bleed clot disorder Subjects use ASA ( aspirin ) , NSAIDs ( NonSteroidal Anti inflammatory Drugs ) , anticoagulant , St. John 's Wort high dos Vitamin E ( recommend daily allowance ) within 2 week prior procedure
